title: Implement CBOR encoding/decoding for records
description:
Implement CBOR (DAG-CBOR) encoding and decoding for AT Protocol records.

Use serde_ipld_dagcbor for CBOR serialization. Handle CID links and blob references.

Reference: https://ipld.io/specs/codecs/dag-cbor/

Features:
- Encode records to DAG-CBOR bytes
- Decode DAG-CBOR bytes to records
- Handle CID links (cid-link type)
- Handle blob references
- Validate encoded/decoded data against Lexicon schema
- Integration with multihash and CID crates

title: Implement Lexicon JSON parsing
description:
Implement JSON deserialization for Lexicon schemas.

Parse Lexicon JSON files into Rust structures. Handle all field types, constraints, and definitions.

Key features:
- Parse lexicon JSON files from disk
- Parse from embedded strings (for testing)
- Validate lexicon version = 1
- Validate NSID format for id field
- Handle all def types (record, query, procedure, etc.)
- Parse nested objects and arrays
- Error handling with detailed messages

title: Implement Lexicon reference resolution
description:
Implement reference resolution for Lexicon schemas.

Handle refs, unions, and cross-schema references. Support both local (within same schema) and external (cross-schema) references.

Features:
- Resolve local refs (#defName)
- Resolve external refs (nsid#defName)
- Union type handling with $type discriminator
- Circular reference detection
- Reference validation
- Schema registry/cache for loaded schemas

title: Implement Lexicon validation logic
description:
Implement schema validation for Lexicon definitions.

Validate Lexicon schemas according to specification rules. Ensure all constraints and requirements are enforced.

Validation rules:
- NSID format validation
- Required fields present
- Type-specific constraints (maxLength, maxGraphemes, etc.)
- String format validation (datetime, did, handle, etc.)
- Array item constraints
- Object required fields
- Union variants have distinct $type
- Reference resolution (validate refs point to valid definitions)
- Enum value validation
